title: Wix Redirect Checker
metaTitle: Wix Redirect Checker | Test Wix Site URL Redirects
metaDescription: Check Wix website redirects, verify URL redirect manager configuration, and ensure proper 301 implementation for Wix SEO.
heroDescription: Test and verify redirects on Wix websites. Check URL redirect manager settings and ensure proper redirect configuration.

children.text: Wix provides a built-in URL Redirect Manager for handling redirects. Access it through: Settings > SEO Tools > URL Redirect Manager. The tool offers:
Automatic redirect creation for deleted or renamed pages
Bulk redirect import via CSV (Premium plans)

When you delete or rename a page in Wix, the platform prompts you to create a redirect. Always accept this prompt to preserve SEO value. If you accidentally skip it, manually create redirects in the URL Redirect Manager.
Moving from username.wixsite.com to your custom domain requires redirects. Wix handles this automatically when you connect a custom domain, but verify with our
Reorganizing your Wix site's navigation or folder structure may change page URLs. Create redirects from old URLs to new ones to maintain search rankings and user bookmarks.
Migrating from WordPress, Shopify, or other platforms to Wix requires comprehensive redirect mapping. Export your old URL list and create corresponding redirects in Wix. See our
Go to Settings in your Wix Dashboard
Click SEO Tools > URL Redirect Manager
Enter new URL or select from site pages
Click 'Save' and test with our redirect checker
Create CSV with columns: Old URL, New URL, Redirect Type
for permanently moved content. This passes SEO value and updates search engine indexes. Best for page deletions, URL structure changes, and migrations.
for short-term changes like seasonal campaigns or A/B testing. These don't pass link equity and should only be used temporarily.
Redirect limits vary by plan (Free plans have restrictions)
No native regex or wildcard support
Cannot redirect to external domains (only internal pages)
Proper redirect implementation is crucial for Wix SEO:
Always create redirects when deleting pages
Monitor redirect chains after multiple page renames
Use Wix SEO Wiz to identify broken links
Connect Google Search Console to monitor crawl errors
Clear browser cache and test in incognito mode
Verify redirect is saved and active in URL Redirect Manager
Check if URL path matches exactly (case-sensitive)
Ensure you're testing on published site, not editor preview
Check for redirect loops (Page A → Page B → Page A)
Review recently added redirects for conflicts
Use our redirect checker to identify the loop source
Multiple page renames create chains (A→B→C). Find chains using our tool, then update redirects to point directly to final destination (A→C) to improve performance.
Compare Wix redirect capabilities with other platforms:
: More flexible with plugins and .htaccess access
: Automatic redirects for product changes, similar to Wix
Wix provides a good balance of ease-of-use and functionality for most websites.
Accept Automatic Redirect Prompts: When Wix offers to create redirects, always accept
Plan URL Structure: Choose permanent page names to minimize future redirects
Test Before Publishing: Verify redirects work in published site, not just preview
Regular Audits: Monthly check of redirect list to remove unnecessary ones

faqs.question: Does Wix automatically create redirects?
faqs.answer: Yes, Wix automatically prompts you to create redirects when you delete or rename pages. Always accept these prompts to preserve SEO value. If you skip the prompt, you can manually create redirects later in the URL Redirect Manager.

faqs.question: How many redirects can I have on Wix?
faqs.answer: Redirect limits vary by Wix plan. Free plans have significant restrictions, while Premium and Business plans offer more redirects. Check your current limit in Settings > URL Redirect Manager. Consider upgrading if you need more redirects.

faqs.question: Can I use 302 temporary redirects on Wix?
faqs.answer: Yes, Wix supports both 301 permanent and 302 temporary redirects. When creating a redirect, you can choose the type. Use 301 for permanent changes and 302 only for truly temporary situations like seasonal campaigns or testing.

faqs.question: How do I redirect my Wix site to a custom domain?
faqs.answer: Connect your custom domain in Wix Settings > Domains. Wix automatically handles redirecting yoursite.wixsite.com to your custom domain. Verify the redirect is working using our domain change checker after connecting.

faqs.question: Will changing page URLs hurt my Wix SEO?
faqs.answer: If properly redirected using 301 redirects, changing page URLs preserves 90-99% of SEO value. Wix prompts you to create redirects when renaming pages. Always create these redirects and test them to ensure they work correctly.

faqs.question: Can I bulk import redirects to Wix?
faqs.answer: Yes, but bulk import is only available on Premium and Business plans. Create a CSV with old URLs, new URLs, and redirect types, then import through URL Redirect Manager. Free plans require manual redirect creation one at a time.

faqs.question: Can I redirect Wix pages to external websites?
faqs.answer: Wix's URL Redirect Manager only supports internal redirects (within your site). To redirect to external sites, you'll need to create a page with a redirect link or use Wix Velo (code) to implement custom redirects.

faqs.question: What happens to Wix redirects when I change templates?
faqs.answer: Redirects are stored separately from templates, so they persist when you change templates. However, changing templates might alter page URLs or structure, requiring new redirects. Always test your site after template changes.

faqs.question: How do I fix redirect chains on Wix?
faqs.answer: Redirect chains occur when you rename pages multiple times (A→B→C). Use our redirect checker to identify chains, then update the original redirect to point directly to the final page (A→C). Edit redirects in URL Redirect Manager to consolidate chains.

faqs.question: Why isn't my Wix redirect working?
faqs.answer: Common causes include: browser cache (clear it and test in incognito), redirect not saved/active in manager, URL path mismatch (case-sensitive), testing in editor preview instead of published site, or redirect limit reached. Verify configuration and test with our tool.
